metadata.description: Tumbuka as spoken in Northern Malawi and Eastern Zambia

examples: Mchere walila - The salt is finished
mchere.culturalContext: Essential cooking ingredient in Tumbuka cuisine
mchere.usage: Used in cooking and food preservation

examples: Chakurya chaluta - The food is ready
Sukulu yili kutali - The school is far
Nkhuyenda ku sukulu - I am going to school
Msika uli kufupi - The market is near
Nkhuyenda ku msika - I am going to the market
msika.usage: Common place for buying and selling

examples: Nkhurya chakurya - I am eating food
Nkhuyenda kugona - I am going to sleep
Nkhugula mtedza - I am buying groundnuts
mtedza.culturalContext: Important crop and food in Tumbuka culture

examples: Nkhupika mphangwe - I am cooking vegetables

asibweni.culturalContext: Important relationship in Tumbuka culture. Has specific roles and responsibilities in family matters.

chemwali.culturalContext: Sisters play important roles in family ceremonies and cultural events.
chemwali.usage: Used for biological and close female relatives of same generation

examples: Mwipwa wakula - The niece/nephew has grown
mwipwa.culturalContext: Important relationship with specific obligations and privileges.

chitumbuka.culturalContext: Encompasses both language and cultural practices of Tumbuka people
chitumbuka.usage: Used when referring to cultural identity and language

examples: Waluta ku chikamwini - He has gone to live at his wife's village
Wali ku chikamwini - He is at his wife's home
chikamwini.culturalContext: Traditional practice where husband lives in wife's village after marriage

examples: Tili na maseko - We have joy
maseko.culturalContext: Community celebrations and expressions of joy, often involving dancing and feasting

examples: Vyakurya va chitumbuka - Tumbuka traditional food
vyakurya.culturalContext: Traditional dishes and food customs, important in ceremonies and daily life

examples: Mphango yayamba - The ceremony has started
mphango.culturalContext: Various traditional ceremonies marking important life events

examples: Mazgu gha wakulu - Words of the elders
Tegelerezgani mazgu - Listen to the words of wisdom
mazgu.culturalContext: Traditional wisdom and teachings passed down through generations
mazgu.usage: Used in giving advice and teaching

sentences.nkhuluta ku msika: I am going to the market

more_expressions.nkhuyenera kuluta ku sukulu: I need to go to school
more_expressions.nkhukhumba kuyowoya nawe: I want to talk with you

examples.nkhuwuka mlenji: I wake up in the morning

examples.nkhuyenda ku msika: I am walking to the market

activity_location.nkhupika mu nyumba: I am cooking in the house

feelings_needs.nili na njara, nkhukhumba chakurya: I am hungry, I need food
feelings_needs.nili na nyota, nkhukhumba maji: I am thirsty, I need water
feelings_needs.nili na tulo, nkhukhumba kugona: I am sleepy, I need to sleep

examples.para mlenji, nkhuyenda ku sukulu: when it's morning, I go to school

examples.chifukwa nili na njara, nkhurya: because I am hungry, I eat
examples.para nili murwari, nkhuruta ku chipatala: if I am sick, I go to hospital
examples.nkhugwira nchito mwakuti nilipire sukulu: I work so that I can pay for school

examples.nkhuluta ku msika kuti nigule chakulya: I go to the market to buy food
examples.nkhufuma ku nyumba kuluta ku sukulu: I go from home to school
examples.nili ku chipatala kuti niwone dokotala: I am at the hospital to see a doctor

examples.nkhupulikiska, kweni nikuyowoya yayi: I understand, but I don't speak
